title: Evaluate RPN expression
problem:
A string is said to be an arithmetical expression in reverse Polish notation (RPN) if:
  1. It is a single digit or a sequence of digits, prefixed with an optional -
  2. It is of the form "A, B, o" where A and B are RPN expression and o is one of +, -, ×, /
An RPN expression can be evaluated uniquely to an integer. Here is an example of an RPN expression. 
7, 3, +, 4, 2, /, / = (7+3) / (4/2) = 5

Write a program that takes an arithmetical expression in RPN and returns the number that the expression evaluates to.
hint: Process subexpressions, keeping values in a stack. How should operators be handled
